intro: Rhodiola staminea, commonly known as the golden root or roseroot, is a perennial flowering plant native to the cold climates of Europe, Asia, and North America. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in alpine and arctic environments, often growing in rocky soils at high altitudes. Rhodiola staminea is notable for its adaptogenic properties, which help it survive in harsh conditions. Its roots are harvested for use in traditional medicine and modern herbal supplements.
